children.description:
The content of the component.

If `' '` is provided, the component reserves one line height for displaying a future message.

classes.description:
Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
See [CSS API](#css) below for more details.

component.description:
The component used for the root node.
Either a string to use a DOM element or a component.

disabled.description: If `true`, the helper text should be displayed in a disabled state.

error.description: If `true`, helper text should be displayed in an error state.

filled.description: If `true`, the helper text should use filled classes key.

focused.description: If `true`, the helper text should use focused classes key.

margin.description:
If `dense`, will adjust vertical spacing. This is normally obtained via context from
FormControl.

required.description: If `true`, the helper text should use required classes key.

descriptions.root: Styles applied to the root element.
descriptions.error: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `error={true}`.
descriptions.disabled: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `disabled={true}`.
descriptions.marginDense: Styles applied to the root element if `margin="dense"`.
descriptions.contained: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="filled"` or `variant="outlined"`.
descriptions.focused: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `focused={true}`.
descriptions.filled: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `filled={true}`.
descriptions.required: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `required={true}`.
